name: My Favorite TV Shows Quiz | TV Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Seven men protect a town called Four Corners from the bad element.
questions.explanation:
"The Magnificent Seven".

	The new version of "The Magnificent Seven" starred Michael Biehn ("Adventure, Inc.") and Eric Close ("Without a Trace"). It was canceled before the second season was officially over. The last show of the series showed Chris finding the person who murdered his wife and son only to have her get away.

questions.text: Four Vietnam veterans help people in need.
questions.explanation:
"The A-Team".

	The 1986-87 season of "The A-Team" had a different theme song and two new members. Robert Vaughn joined the show as General Stockwell and Eddie Velez joined the show as Frankie Santana.

questions.text: A man uses his wit and ingenuity to get out of some tough problems; duct tape and a good Swiss Army knife helps as well.
questions.explanation:
"MacGyver".

	"MacGyver" was a one of a kind television show because the main character never used a gun and hated violence.

questions.text: Two Miami police officers fight corruption in Miami; there's also an alligator named Elvis.
questions.explanation:
"Miami Vice".

	"Miami Vice" made Don Johnson and Phillip Michael Thomas the MTV cops of the eighties. Jan Hammer created the theme song and "In The Air Tonight" was the unofficial theme song of the show. Julia Roberts and Sheena Easton were only two of the special guest stars.

questions.text: A fast talking, fast walking group of people help the President solve problems that most of the time they've caused.
questions.explanation:
"The West Wing".

	"The West Wing" is a multiple Emmy, SAG, People's Choice Award and Golden Globe winner.

questions.text: Two brothers start up their own private investigation agency.
questions.explanation:
"Simon and Simon".

	There were two versions of the "Simon and Simon" theme song, but the rock 'n roll version is the most recognizable.

questions.text: Two lawyers defend and protect the military all while fighting feelings for each other.
questions.explanation:
"JAG".

	"JAG" aired on NBC in 1995 and was picked up by CBS in 1997. The show has left many cliff hangers that leave viewers on the edge of their seats.

questions.text: With the help of a Indian bounty hunter and his sister, Reno Raines hunts down bounties while trying to keep himself from getting arrested.
questions.explanation:
"Renegade".

	"Renegade" ended with a little bit of poetic justice as Dutch Dixon (Stephen J. Cannell) ends up on the run from the law just like Reno.

questions.text: Love, deceit, betrayal and murder sparked this drama about a family of wine sellers in Tuscany Valley.
questions.explanation:
"Falcon Crest".

	At the series finale of "Falcon Crest", Richard remarried, Lance had 10% control of Falcon Crest and Angela remembered the comings and goings of everyone that came through Falcon Crest.

questions.text: The one with six friends in New York.
questions.explanation:
"Friends".

	"Friends" gave us lines like 'How you doing?', and 'Oh. .My. .God!' Love interests like Paolo and fun Bobby, Janice and Kathy. Games like fire ball game and the trivia game. Songs like 'Smelly Cat' and 'The Snowman Song' and six friends that will live on in syndication and in infamy.
